interpolate

Class Interpolator

  • java.lang.Object
    • interpolate.Interpolator

  • public class Interpolator
extends Object
    This class contains static methods to run interpolation.

    • Method Detail

      • triangulate

        public static MyHashSet<Triangle> triangulate(MyArrayList<Point> listOfPoints)
        Creates a set of valid Delaunay triangles based on given list of points. This algorithm runs in O(n^3) time.
        Parameters:
        listOfPoints - list of points where to create Delaunay triangles
        Returns:
        set of Delaunay triangles, null if there is none

      • interpolateMatrix

        public static double[][] interpolateMatrix(int width,
                                           int height,
                                           MyArrayList<Point> listOfPoints,
                                           MyHashSet<Triangle> triangles,
                                           int classes)
        Interpolates values to a matrix by given list of points. Algorithm first creates a set of valid Delaunay triangles by given list of points. With triangles it calculates using barycentric coordinates a value for every element in matrix. If the pixel is outside of any triangle it gets value "NaN". After interpolation this matrix can be processed to a image file.
        Parameters:
        width - width of output matrix
        height - height of output matrix
        listOfPoints - list of points from to interpolate values
        triangles - set of valid Delaunay triangles
        classes - in how many different values interpolated values are classified, usually between 10-50
        Returns:
        matrix with interpolated values

      • interpolateInverseDistance

        public static double[][] interpolateInverseDistance(int width,
                                                    int height,
                                                    MyArrayList<Point> listOfPoints,
                                                    double serachRadius,
                                                    double p,
                                                    int classes)
        Interpolates values to a matrix by given list of points with inverse distance weight method. This method calculates values for element in matrix by taking all points inside the given search radius and calculates the value by distances to other points. General formula is something like: sum(p.weight / d(p)^p) / sum(1/d(p)^p), where d(p) is distance from current element to the point inside search radius. If there is not any points inside search radius, element gets value NaN
        Parameters:
        width - width of output matrix
        height - height of output matrix
        listOfPoints - list of points from to interpolate values
        serachRadius - search radius, that is how far away points affect interpolation
        p - distance to the power of p, usually value between 1 and 2
        classes - in how many different values interpolated values are classified, usually between 10-50
        Returns:
        matrix with interpolated values

      • classifyValue

        public static int classifyValue(double value,
                                double[] minAndMaxValues,
                                int classes)
        Returns a equal interval classified value of input. That is done by calculating a range of given minium and maximum value and divided by the amount of classes. Output is integer between 0 and amount of classes.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to classify
        minAndMaxValues - arrays of min and max values used in interpolation, see MyMath.getMaxAndMinValues(utils.MyArrayList)
        classes - Amount of classes used in classification
        Returns:
        Classified value, or -1 if value is NaN
